required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Acceptance and Commitment Therapy in Primary Health Care
clinical_study.official_title: How Does Education of Health Personnel With Acceptance and Commitment Therapy Affect the Extent of Medical Certificates of Sick Leave and Drug Prescriptions?

collaborator.agency: County Councils of Region Östergötland, Kalmar and Jönköping

brief_summary.textblock: How does education of health personnel with Acceptance and Commitment Therapy affect the extent of medical certificates of sick leave and drug prescriptions in primary health care centers in Kalmar compared with similar centers in Jönköping in which the personnel do not get such therapy?

detailed_description.textblock: Five primary health care centers in the County Council of Jönköping who do not get education according to Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) serve as controls. Six primary health care centers in County Council of Kalmar, with the same total number of listed patients (about 45 000 in total per County Council) in their areas undergo group education according to ACT. Data on medical certificates of sick leave and drug prescriptions are taken from registries (this is routine in primary health care in Sweden) at baseline and after 6, 12 and 24 months in both regions. The personnel at both centers also fill out questionnaires about their own quality of life at baseline and after 12 months. The investigators also plan to interview about 20 subjects on these matters.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective non-randomized trial with one interventional group and a parallel group without intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Extent of medical certificates of sick leave by the doctors
primary_outcome.description: Data on entire extent of medical certificates, i.e. how many sick days that were certified by all doctors at the primary health care centers, for all patients treated, during the time period.

primary_outcome.measure: Prescription of drugs by the doctors
primary_outcome.description: Data on all prescription of all different drugs, during the time period, made by all the doctors at the primary Health care centers that participate, to all patients that were treated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of how the education with ACT affect the personnel according to SF36
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire SF36 is filled out by the personnel at baseline and after 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of how the education with ACT affect the personnel according to KEDS
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire Karolinska Exhaustion Disorder Scale (KEDS) is filled out by the personnel at baseline and after 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of how the education with ACT affect the personnel according to WAI
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire Work ability Index (WAI) is filled out by the personnel at baseline and after 12 months

clinical_study.condition: Medical Certificates for Sick Leave and Drug Prescriptions

arm_group.arm_group_label: ACT in County Council of Kalmar
arm_group.description: Group education with ACT in six primary health care centers in County Council of Kalmar

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control health care centers of County Council of Jönköping
arm_group.description: Five primary health care centers of County Council of Jönköping that do not get education.

intervention.intervention_name: Education with Acceptance and Commitment Therapy
intervention.description: Group education with Acceptance and Commitment Therapy of the personnel at each center.
intervention.arm_group_label: ACT in County Council of Kalmar
Control health care centers of County Council of Jönköping

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- over 18 years of age
- working at the health care center
Exclusion Criteria:
- age less than 18 years
- do not work at the Health care center

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences

responsible_party.investigator_title: MD PhD, consultant in internal medicine, professor of internal medicine
